page.title: 02Buxhall - Farming: General
page.content: Agriculture is the most important industry of the area. The farms are all{owner-occupied, family farms mainly bought in C.1920. Eight employ no labour other than family and five have outside workers, generally living nearby. A total of 31 people work the 1000 ha. of farmland comprising the 13 farms. The soil is mainly heavy {boulder clay}with underground pipe drainage making it ideally suited to {intensive arable}production.There is little grassland of any description. Large modern{farm buildings}are not generally conspicuous on the landscape - a few are situated among the trees on the edge of Rattlesden airfield,and others blend well with a generally unspoilt countryside. Many of the traditional farm buildings have been adapted for modern uses; principally the storage of grain.
